ICS-271, Introduction to Artificial Intelligence, Fall 2006
main | announcements | home work | lecture notes

Project

    Project Teams

    1. Team 1

      • Members: Ronen Vaisenberg, Shengyue Ji
      • Papers:
        1. Design of Heuristic Functions. R. Korf (2006)
        2. Disjoint Pattern Database Heuristics. R. Korf (2001)

    2. Team 2

      • Members: Hootan Shirani-Mehr
      • Papers:
        1. Combining Knowledge Compilation and Search for Efficient Conformant Probabilistic Planning. Jinbo Huang (ICAPS'06 - Session 1.1)
        2. Concurrent Probabilistic Planning in the Graphplan Framework. Iain Little, Sylvie Thiebaux (ICAPS'06 - Session 1.2)

    3. Team 3

      • Members: Gabe Moothart, Arthur Asuncion
      • Papers:
        1. Fast Probabilistic Planning through Weighted Model Counting. Carmel Domshlak, Joerg Hoffman (ICAPS'06 - Session 3.1)
        2. Conformant Planning via Heuristic Forward Search: A New Approach. Ronen I. Brafman and Joerg Hoffman (ICAPS'04)
        3. Solving Bayesian Networks by Weighted Model Counting. Tian Sang, Paul Beame, and Henry Kautz (AAAI'05)

    4. Team 4

      • Members: Ray Juang, Pinaki Sinha
      • Papers:
        1. Goal Achievement in Partially Known Partially Observable Domains. Allen Chang, Eyal Amir (ICAPS'06 - Session 4.1)
        2. Learning Partially Observable Deterministic Action Models. Eyal Amir (IJCAI'05)
        3. Learning Partially Observable Action Models. Eyal Amir (Technical Report'05)

    5. Team 5

      • Members: Jean, Grace, Chang
      • Papers:
        1. Learning Depth-First Search. Blai Bonet, Hector Geffner (ICAPS'06 - Session 4.2)
        2. Compiling Uncertainty Away: Solving Conformant Planning Problems Using a Classical Planner. H. Palacios, H. Geffner (AAAI'06)
        3. Heuristics for Planning with Penalties and Rewards using Compiled Knowledge. B. Bonet, H. Geffner (KR'06)

    6. Team 6

      • Members: Kevin Xu, Hao Wang
      • Papers:
        1. Memory-Efficient Symbolic Heuristic Search. Rune Jensen, Eric Hansen, Simon Richards, Rong Zhou (ICAPS'06 - Session 5.1)
        2. Space-Efficient Memory-Based Heuristics. R. Zhou and E. Hansen. (AAAI'04)
        3. Breadth-First Heuristic Search. R. Zhou and E. Hansen. (ICAPS'04)

    7. Team 7

      • Members: Todd Johnson, Darren Strash
      • Papers:
        1. Optimal Rectangle Packing: A Meta-CSP Approach. Michael Moffitt, Martha Pollack (ICAPS'06 - Session 6.3)

    8. Team 8

      • Members: Justin Tang
      • Papers:
        1. Exploiting the Power of Local Search in a Branch and Bound Algorithm for Job Shop Scheduling. Matthew Streeter, Stephen Smith (ICAPS'06 - Session 6.2)

    9. Team 9

      • Members: Mikhail Kalinin, Nathan Sutter
      • Papers:
        1. Sequential Monte Carlo in Probabilistic Planning Reachability Heuristics. Daniel Bryce, Subbarao Kambhampati, David Smith (ICAPS'06 - Session 3.2)

    10. Team 10

      • Members: Sulagna Basu, Mei Li
      • Papers:
        1. Compiling Uncertainty Away: Solving Conformant Planning Problems Using a Classical Planner.
        2. Easy and Hard Conformant Planning .
        3. Explicit Planning and explicit knowledge.
        4. Approximate reasoning about actions in presence of sensing and incomplete information.
        5. A knowledge based approach to planning with incomplete information and sensing.

    11. Team 11

      • Members: Lars Otten, Rares Vernica
      • Papers:
        1. External-Memory Pattern Databases Using Structured Duplicate Detection. R. Zhou, E. Hansen (AAAI'05)
        2. Beam-Stack: Integrating Backtracking with Beam Search. R. Zhou, E. Hansen (ICAPS'05)

    12. Team 12

      • Members: Ritesh Subramanian, Tanmay Goel
      • Papers:
        1. Predictive Planning for Supply Chain Management. David Pardoe, Peter Stone (ICAPS'06 - Session 8.1)
        2. Designing and Evaluating an Adaptive Trading Agent for Supply Chain Management Applications. Minghua He, Alex Rogers, Esther David, and Nicholas R. Jennings.
        3. TacTex-05: An Adaptive Agent for TAC SCM. David Pardoe, Peter Stone, and Mark VanMiddlesworth (TADA/AAMAS'06)

    13. Team 13

      • Members: Yongkang Zhu, Zshani
      • Papers:
        1. On Some Tractable Cases of Logical Filtering. T. K. Satish Kumar, Stuart Russell (ICAPS'06 - Session 9.1)

    14. Team 14

      • Members: Ajay Mishra, Sameer Saproo
      • Papers:
        1. Optimal Route Planning under Uncertainty. Evdokia Nikolova, Matthew Brand, David Karger (ICAPS'06 - Session 2.2)
        2. Improved Results for Route Planning in Stochastic Transportation Networks. J. Boyan and M. Mitzenmacher. (SODA'01)


School of Information and Computer Science University of California, Irvine, CA 92697-3435 Dr. Rina Dechter dechter at ics.uci.edu
